column1: a shortish loosener from the offspinner, turns away to give him room, Gunathilaka rocks back and flays a cut through the covers
brilliant follow-up. Rips away from a good length around off-stump and beats him on the front foot
fuller this time and curves in towards off, presses forward and pushes it out into the off side
fullish length, slid in towards off and straightening just enough to miss the off-stump as the batsman lets it go
too close to cut, shortish and he backs away to force the shot but gets beaten
floated up on off, driven down to log-off
short of a length, pitches outside leg, tucked to midwicket for one
back of a length on middle and leg, defended into the covers off the front foot
fullish length on off, pushes it uppishly towards mid-off
short of a length,nips away from him, gets slightly squared up as he loosely hangs his bat out without moving his feet and gets beaten
short of good length on the fifth-stump channel, drops into the off side off the backfoot
back of a length on middle, gets on top and nudges into midwicket for one
full and curving in on middle and leg, driven to long-off off the front foot
good length, spinning away from well outside off, defended off the front foot with an open face towards point
rips past the edge! He is caught on neither foot and it turns just enough from a fuller length
backs away but doesn't pick the arm ball that slides into him at pace, he chops it into the surface and is lucky it doesn't hit the stumps

and Bangladesh have their first breakthrough. And it arrives via a gift. Poor, poor shot early in the innings from Gunathilaka. Clears the front leg and tries to loft this fuller ball straight over. But it's a bit too full and he can't get underneath that entirely. Knocks it high into the air and long-off runs to his left to snaffle it
shortish, a little width, slapped to point
short and wide, opens up for a well-timed punch through the extra cover region
cuts in from a good length towards off, stays in the crease and defends towards mid-on
short of a length, gets on top from the confines of his crease and turns it away to midwicket for a very quick single. Direct hit, and it would have been a lot closer
short of good length, pitches outside leg and climbs onto him unexpectedly to strike him on the back glove. Shades of Johannesburg
short of a length, pitches outside leg and arrives around a fourth-stump channel, punched solidly into the off side
variable bounce again. Keeps low from a back of a length, forcing him to make a late adjustment as he turns it away to backward square leg
slightly flatter trajectory but he's picked the length early.It's pretty full and he gets down on one knee and carves it away over deep midwicket
overcompensation with the length. Drops it short and Mendis rocks back and pulls with might through deep square leg
advances down the ground and meets the pitch before carving it straight over long-on. Minimal power, maximum timing. And maximum result!
this one's not as well-timed. Slightly chipped in the air but he's played it well enough. Comes down the track and launches a length ball over long-on
full outside off, punched down to long-on. Finally some respite from the madness
slider on leg stump, pushed away into midwicket. Very, very expensive over from Miraz. Surely must be the end of his first spell?
short of a length outside off, opens the face and drops it to point
short of a length on off, defended off the front foot towards mid-off
sprayed down the leg side, all Tharanga needed to do was put bat as he helps it along to deep fine leg
short, wide, cut hard and point intercepts it
short, bounces more this time, Tharanga arches back and slaps to cover-point who moves to his left in a hurry and stops it with a dive

oh, dear! Kusal Mendis has thrown it away. He looked in a hurry throughout and he's just played a shot he'll be cross with himself for. Tries to force a pull to the wrong line and length and chips it in the air right off the bottom of the bat to give mid-on some catching practice. Mashrafe is pretty pumped up after that scalp. Doesn't hold back from expressing himself
presses forward to a fuller ball and defends
pushed back to the right of the bowler
short and wide, gently cut to point
driven with an open face to backward point
uppish through the cover. Advances down the ground and chips a drive but he's placed it perfectly through the gap at covers
full on the stumps, pushed down to long-off
short of a length, pitching outside leg, tucked to midwicket
keeps very low from a back of a length, defended down the pitch in front of middle
full on leg, chipped off the pads over the midwicket and square leg region

oh, my! That's the most bizarre piece of shot selection you'll probably ever see.It's back of a length, and what does he do? Walks across and gets down on one knee to scoop. Needless to say, all he manages is t get hit on some part of the body
turned away to backward square leg and they push back for a rapid second, much to Mashrafe's annoyance
fullish length outside off, driven with an open face to point
full, sliding on leg, swept to square leg
short and spinning away, reaches out and pats it away through third man. Timed
fullish, curving in on off, driven into the off side
short of a length, drops into the off side from the crease
good length on middle at pace, defended

how was that? Drifting down the leg side perhhow was that? Drifting down the leg side perhaps but Mashrafe takes the review. This could be umpire's call. Looped into middle on a length and coming on with the angle to beat the inside edge and hit the pad. No bat involved. Clipping leg stump, so on-field decision remainsps but Mashrafe takes the review. This could be umpire's call. But Bangladesh retain their review
short of a length outside off, punched into the covers
good length outside off, textbook defence into the covers
ripper! A scorching length ball that cuts off the seam to beat the outside edge and the off-stump as it sharply angles across him
back of a length outside off, drops it into cover
short of a length outside off, runs it down to third man
walks across to a fuller ball and defends into the off side
tries to force a cut but is tucked up and the ball bounces over the bat
fuller this time but now he gets the width he's looking for, deftly steered to third man
good length on off, defended
full on middle and leg, driven to long-off
advances down the track and the ball goes off the inside of the bat towards midwicket
full and sliding again, finds the inside of the bat as he drills
full, pitching outside leg, clipped through square leg for a brace
back of a length, tucked with the angle to midwicket
short, wide, chopped to point
full, on the fifth-stump channel, punched with a closed face to mid-on
full around off, pushed into the covers
fullish, wide outside off, and that's a top shot again. Very deftly played again with an open face to third man
pushed in front of point for a very quick single
slides in with the arm and goes into the leg side off the inside of the bat as he presses forward to defend
full and tight on middle, defended down the pitch off the front foot
similar line and length, blocked
backs away and opens the face for a cut but gets tucked up and beaten
pushed uppishly to extra cover as a fuller one stops on him a little
short of a length, opens the face for a punch through backward point
short of a length, drifts down leg and gets too big on him as well to make contact with the tuck
cuts in from a back of a length and he squeezes it away through short third man after rushing back
short of a length, opens the face to guide to point
full outside off, driven to mid-off
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man

shout for leg before. Not given. Mashrafe thinks and thinks and thinks and finally his arms swing up to conjure up the review signal. Looks like this may miss leg considerably. It has beaten the flick and the ball has cut in significantly from a short of a length. Ball-tracking is taking a while. Wickets missing, and unlike last time, Bangladesh lose their review
slides in towards off with the arm, makes some room and stabs to point
full, curving in a lot more sharply on middle, blocked
comes down the track and wristily whips a length ball to long-on
fullish length, opens the face and steers through the covers

this one looks close and has been given. Dickwella almost immediately signals for the review, and rightly so, because this curved into him. Comes on at too full a length to do anything significant after pitching. Comes on with the arm to hit the pad. But hang on, there's an inside edge and the decision is overturned
full on off, driven down to long-on
slashes at a wide delivery to covers
length on middle, flicked to midwicket
short of a length, cuts in, chops into the surface as he opens up for a big slash
short, wide, stabbed to point after getting on top
short of a length on off, backs away and opens the face to drop to point
hangs back and opens the face to steer it fine behind square on the off side. Brilliant save at the third man boundary as the fielder runs and dives full-length to his right
fullish length, clipped to square leg
advances down the ground and punches into the off side
advances and flicks, chips it in the air but well to the left of the bowler. Again the two-paced nature of the surface coming to the fore
short of a length, punched down to long-on
driven to sweeper cover
comes down the track and meets the pitch before driving to wide long-off
hangs back ad opens the face to point
good length, spins past the outside edge as he presses forward
full on middle, driven back
advances and adjusts to the shorter length by flaying it to the sweeper at cover
full outside off, more work for sweeper as it's driven out
short of a length, slides in with the arm on off, backs away and punches through the covers
full and sliding on leg, pushed down to long-on
comes down the track and drills it to extra cover
flicks a fullish one from outside off to long-on
fuller, angling in on off, drilled back off the inside of the bat
driven to cover
sliding on leg, wears it on the pad as he tries to flick and the ball goes to short fine leg
comes charging down and pushes it out into the off sde
fuller, presses forward and blocks
stays back to a length ball that keeps low and punches towards mid-on
short of a length, this time he stands tall and punches to the right of the bowler
defended off the inside of the bat into the on side
full on off, driven to wide long-off
advances, meets the pitch and drives to mid-on where Mashrafe makes a diving stop
fuller, driven to extra cover
slider on leg, flicked behind square to fine leg
length, straightens outside off, slaps off the backfoot to long-on
full outside off, driven into covers
chipped in the air but safely past the in-field. It swings away and as a result he chips it off the outer half of the bat. One-bounce over long-off
slower this time, meets the pitch outside off and drives to sweeper cover
did that carry? A stunning effort from Rahim. Tharanga opened tehe face to one that jagged away and Rahim flings himself to his left and gets a glove to it with the ball dying on him
pushes away from the body without moving the feet and gets beaten
full outside off, driven to long-off
full around off, punched to covers
full on middle, flicked to long-on
short of a length, backs away and punches to the left of the bowler
full outside off, pushed into the covers
length ball around off, that's the ideal length for the sweep and he crunches it over the cow corner region
short and wide, backs away and cuts through cover
short of a length, opens the face to third man
loosely hangs the bat out to one that jags away without moving the feet and the ball beats the bat
short of a length, outside off, opens the face and runs down to third man
gets beaten as he flashes outside

ah, what has Dickwella done here? Gets a shortish delivery that pitches on leg stump and gets slightly big on him. He closes the face but is completely stifled to play any sort of meaningful shot. Closes the face early and gets a leading edge as the ball lobs in the air for point to settle under it
good length, flicked through square leg
full and sliding, defended
comes down the track and tries to flick, gets hit on the pad as the ball trickles away behind the stumps on the off side. Appeal turned down because of an inside edge
fuller on off, flicked into the leg side
full and accurate outside off, drilled back
pitched up on middle and off, drilled down the pitch
good length, slides in to find the inside edge and hit the back pad
short of a length, opens the face to third man
full and angling in, clipped off the pads to midwicket
short of a length, flicked off the pads behind the square leg umpire
full, slower at 118.5kph and pushed across, driven wide of the long-off fielder
back of a length, cuts in towards off, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, drilled off the splice to the bowler
short of a length on middle, backs away and mistimes a cut to point
full on middle, flicked to midwicket
dropped. Advances down the ground and chips an inside-out drive to cover. The fielder gets up with both hands outstretched but the ball grazes the fingers and gets past him
full outside off, beat front-foot defense into the off side
good length on middle and off, defended off the front foot
advances down the ground and drives a fuller one to long-off
extremely full, almost a yorker, swings in on leg, clipped to mid-on
good length outside off, leans forward into a punch to covers
rolls the fingers for the cutter outside off but floats up a full toss that's driven out to sweeper cover
back of a length, cross-seamer, keeps low and Tharanga fails to adjust as he gets beaten
good length on off, drops into the point region with an open face
chipped in the air but safe. A slower ball that stops on him a little, closes the face and skews it off the splice. Midwicket runs forward and the ball drops short
good length, spins in, rocks back and flays a pull to the right of deep midwicket
good length on off, punched into the covers
full, pushes early and uppishly knocks it to cover
full on middle, defends to point. Tharanga sets off for a single but is sent back
short, not much room and keeps low, chops a cut to point
good length on middle, punched solidly to mid-off
hangs the bat loosely to an away-nipping length ball and gets beaten
fullish, angled across on off, pats a drive into the covers
back of a length, angled across on off, opens the face and drops to point for one
full and wide, mistimed drive to cover
short of a length, angling on middle, turned away off the inside of the bat to deep square leg
short of a length, opens the face to point
shortish, pulled to deep square leg
fullish length, flicked to midwicket
mistimed sweep, lands safe. Fetches it from way outside off and skews it to deep midwicket region in the air
shortish, punched to sweeper cover
backs away and drops a length ball to cover
turned away to deep backward square leg
fullish length, flicked off the pads behind square leg
short of a length, pitches outside leg, flicks into the leg side
short, sitting up nicely outside off but because he has to fetch it, he doesn't middle a pull. Enough to get it away to deep midwicket though and enough to give him his fifty
back of a length, off the outside of the bat to third man
good length, cuts in and he defends to point
good length on middle, flicked to square leg
comes down the track but it's too short to his liking. Can't meet the pitch and gets hit on the pad
gets down for a sweep and the ball slides in to trickle to fine leg off the pad
full on middle and off, eased down to long-off
full on middle, flicked off the pads to backward square leg with powerful wrists
and even as I say that, Chandimal gets down for an imperious reverse sweep over backward point. Much-needed ease in pressure
back of a length, opens the face and runs down to third man
full on middle, drilled back
short of a length on off, cautiously blocks into the off side
full, chases away from the body and drives to third man off the outside of the bat
short of a length, opens the face to third man
full, wide, chases as it drifts away further and gets beaten
full outside leg, off the pads towards short fine as he looks to clip it out
full on off, driven to mid-off
slower full ball at 124.2ks, rolled his fingers over it, drilled straight back
short, wide, opens the face to point who dives to his left
short of a length, pitches outside leg, guided to point with an open face
no man's land again. Tharanga puts his wrists to use again. It's full and slower, stops on him and he mistimes a flick, chipping it in the air towards the cow corner boundary
full on middle and leg, flicked wide of mid-on

plumb. Tharanga is discussing with Chandimal for the review and decides to take it but hard to see this get overturned. Scrambled seam fuller length ball, misses the inside edge as Tharanga presses forward. Ah. That has actually nipped back in sharply and Hawkeye says the angle would have carried it past the leg stump. Tharanga survives

gone next ball. Completely messes up the timing on his pull. He rolls his fingers over a shortish one and as a result the ball doesn't get up as much as Tharanga anticipated as well. Shoots past from underneath the bat and cuts in to hit the stumps. 50th ODI wicket for Mustafizur
short of a length, seams back in, tucked with the angle into the on side
short ball, very well-directed and forcing the batsman to very hurriedly swing out of the line
short of a length, defended from the crease to mid-off
full on the pads, flicked to square leg
was that in the air?. Short ball, pulls dominantly and forcefully but straight to midwicket who makes a brilliant stop getting down to his right
full and right on the stumps, pushed back
back of a length and some width, punched with an open face through the cover region
short of good length, punched to cover
misses everything. Top delivery from Rubel. A rip-roaring length ball that cuts in, beats the inside edge, goes over the pad, and finally the stumps with all three in line
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
fullish length outside off, defended into the covers
good length on middle, defended
short, outside off, ducked
short, ducks as the ball goes over middle and leg
full on off, driven to mid-off
shortish, cuts in late to beat Chandimal's flashing blade
rips in prdigiously and hits the pad. Huge shout for lbw but that was missing leg given the sharp angle
short ball, Thisara shapes up to pull but the ball jags away after pitching and as a result Thisara is forced to fetch it and skews it in the air off the bottom of the bat. Midwicket settles under it
chops this back of a length delivery as he tries to force a slap close to off and sets off for a run. Beats the throw to make the non-striker's end as fine leg runs in and hurls a throw
cuts in from a length and Gunaratne turns it away to square leg
jags away considerably from a good length and beats the outside edge as he sticks the bat out
walks a long way across and exposes all three stumps. Gets a cross-seaming length ball that pitches outside leg, angles away and bounces over the stumps. That was a comedic sequence of events
good length, pushed back to the bowler
back-of-the-hand slower ball, short of a length, opens the face for a drop to point
short, wide, another back-of-the-hand slower one, chops a cut to point
short of a length, pitched outside leg, flicked to deep fine leg
length ball angling into off and middle, clipped to midwicket
short on off stump, pulled to the right of the diving midwicket fielder and they pick up two by the time deep square leg runs around to cut it off
back of a length close to off stump, punched to short extra-cover
length ball on off stump, punched to the right of short extra, and long-off comes in off the boundary to stop it
fullish outside off, a bit of off-cut on it, defended into the point region
fullish outside off, once again gets forward and defends towards point

length ball angling across to off stump, and they pick up the single after Shakib sprints in from extra-cover, throws himself forward, tries the pick-up-and-scoop to the bowler's end, but fails to collect the ball cleanly. He's still down on the floor. Wonder if he's landed awkwardly and hurt himself in some way
full on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended punchily into the covers
shortish, doesn't climb as much as expected as he aims a pull at it. Hits the flap of his pads (pitched outside leg, so no lbw appeal), and pops up to short third man
short outside off, stops on him and his attempted slap through point rolls slowly to the left of extra-cover
length ball close to off stump, defended to backward point
full on middle and leg, flicked to long-on
short of a length, keeps low, flicked to midwicket
short of a length, nips in towards off, punched to cover
full, shaping in from outside off, pushed out through the covers
was that off the bat. Doesn't look like. At least to the umpire anyway. Short ball that pitches on off, Chandimal jumps up and tries to flick but the ball hits the back thigh and goes to the keeper
punches a length ball to long-on
short and wide, cut to point
short of a length, pitches outside leg, flicked against the line to midwicket
back of a length, opens the face to backward point. Gunaratne wants the single but is sent back. There's a direct throw at the bowler's end and they eventually take the single off the deflection
back of a length outside off, dropped to the cover region
short of a length, closes the face as the ball jags away and gets a leading edge to third man
short, wide, cut hard to point
short of good length, pulled between wide long-on and deep midwicket

full, angling in and hits the pad. Seems momentarily as if there's an inside edge. The umpire raises his finger and Gunaratne reviews it. Swings in the air and comes in further off the deck to gets past the attempt at a flick. So no inside edge. And it's clipping leg stump
short of a length, angled across, pats it away through the cover and point region

short of a length, comes into him and hits the pad as he tries to get on top and flick. The ball's hit the pad off an inside edge and lobbed towards point. They attempt a quick single and then take another one off the deflection from a direct hit
punched straight back and crashes into the stumps at the non-striker's end
back of a length, defended into the covers from front of off
full outside off, driven through the covers
back of a length, drifts well down the leg side
strikes the pad with a sharp incomer and goes up in appeal. Missing leg perhaps. Inside edge as well
direct hit would have sent him back. Or he may have just made it after that timely dive. A yorker that was dug out to cover. Chandimal immediately took off for a single and was sent back
full on off, clears the front leg and carves it over extra cover
full, angled across outside off, driven through the covers
good length on middle, pitching outside leg and coming on middle, drop-and-run into the covers
backs away to a full delivery that comes into him and swings blindly as the ball gets past him and the off stump
short of a length, top-edges a pull and it lands safe in the midwicket region
shortish outside off, backs away but the ball follows him by jagging in and he chops it ito the surface
oh, dear! A beamer that he ducks under but comes on dangerously high. Must have slipped out of the hand. Whatever it was, it earns him a free-hit and a warning
stays leg side of this short ball and completely mistimes a pull. Needed to get closer to the line. Not much of a chance swinging like that. Missed opportunity there

is that another no-ball? Yup, it is. Another beamer on middle and off and Dananjaya backs away slightly to free himself up and muscles a pull over deep midwicket. Six, extra run, extra ball and a free-hit.Jeez, these are valuable late runs that they are leaking
full toss, coming in on middle and leg, drilled down the pitch and they sprint back for the second

a perfect, searing yorker. Angled on middle and right on the money. Chandimal gets the front leg out, does not maintain any good position and swings across the line as the ball clatters into the stumps
fullish, angles in, tucked through midwicket
very full outside leg, gets the front foot out and swings across to get an inside edge to deep square leg
fullish length, cuts in to hit him in front of middle and leg. Probably bouncing over
advances down the ground and swipes to get an inside edge towards square leg
proper catch practice to cover. Can't possibly get out in a tamer fashion. Simply backs away to a short of a length delivery and chips it straight and gently into the hands of Mithun
short of a length, back-of-the-hand, cuts away, taps it through the square leg region
full on middle and leg, punched to the right of mid-on
low full toss outside off, dips enough for it to almost become a yorker, drilled back
swing and a miss a fullish one curves in late from well outside off
another scorching yorker. Very similar to the one that cleaned up Chandimal. Madushanka can't get anywhere underneath that and swings and misses as the ball clatters into middle and off
short of a length outside off, swings without getting behind the line and misses
short of a length, again makes no effort to get behind it and drags it off the toe end down the pitch

fullish, curving in, stays away from it and swipes big. Misses and they take off for a bye. The run was always non-existent but this is the last ball of the innings and they make the dash. Anyway, it results in a run out at the striker's end by Rahim and Sri Lanka are all out
short of a length on leg stump, nudged into the leg side
short of a length, slanted across, keeps a little low as he lets it go
back of a length, angled across in the corridor of uncertainty, Tamim is quite the obedient chap as he keeps the bat inside the line
ah, now he gets distracted and is lured like a kid is by a candy. Sticks his bat out to a back of a length away-nipper and gets beaten
length ball, lures him by firing it in the corridor again, back to basics as he keeps the bat inside the line
fullish, pushed across, left alone. Maiden to start off
shortish, jags away off the seam, shoulders arms
shapes away from a good length, no shot offered
short of good length, prodigious movement off the deck, he isn't going after those
short ball that gets over middle, ducks hurriedly
short of good length outside off, punches crisply to point who dives to his left and gets a hand to it
good length outside off, comes forward to defend and finds an inside edge just wide of midwicket. Uses that gap for a very quick single
good length, asking him to fish at the corridor of uncertainty again, Tamim sticks his bat out and gets narrowly beaten
walks forward and closes the face but gets a leading edge
good length, pushes forward and gets an inside edge to square leg
good length on off, pats it towards mid-on
good length on off, defended back
good length on off, defended solidly. Very tight start from Sri Lanka but Bangladesh must be careful not to get too ultra-defensive, especially if there are doubts surrounding Shakib's ability to bat
chases a really wide delivery and gets a thickish outside edge through backward point
tucked from front of middle to midwicket
fullish length, slanted across, crunches a drive to cover
short of a length outside off, drops it into the covers off the backfoot
short, well-directed around the leg-stump channel, forcing him to scamper under it
short of a length, shuffles across and blocks
short of a length, gets slightly big as he closes the face and pops a leading edge that nearly carries to point
short, angles in on middle and leg and sits up nicely. Mithun crunches a pull and helps it over deep square leg
short of a length, defended into the off side
good length, takes a good stride across and defends back
short of a length outside off, covers the line and blocks
short of a length, gets on top and defends awkwardly into the off side
shortish, not enough room and pacy, tries to pull and the ball gets over the bat

dropped. But a brilliant effort. That was absolutely hammered. Didn't even have the time to blink. Tamim charged down but took himself away from the line a tad too much. As a result, he drills it straight back to the right of the bowler but off the toe end of the bat. Chameera gets down to his right valiabtly but a split-second earlier would have given him a better chance

and Tamim looks a gift horse in the mouth. Gives his wicket away next ball. Shortish with zero room. Tamim tries to force a pull. The runs weren't coming and he was desperate. Manages a healthy top-edge that is taken at midwicket
edged and short. Pushes way away from the body, a length ball that nips away subtly from a fifth-stump channel. Gets an edge that drops short of second slip diving forward
wears it on the pad as he tries to flick this with the angle
short of a length, tries to flick but the ball slides in to hit the pad on its way to square leg
short, wide, chops a slap with a half-angled bat to cover
good length on the fourth-stump line, punched into the covers
length, defended back
short of a length outside off, punched to point
good length, nips into middle, tucked to midwicket
short of a length, defended to point
short of good length, nips away and he opens up for a punch through backward point
short of a length, defended in front of off
short of a length, keeps lower than he thought it'd, and rushes him with pace as he swings early on the pull
good length, a neat front-foot defence into the covers. A sloppy effort in the field gives them a single that never should have been
short, gets over off
short ball, gets well over off, no stroke attempted

oh, a run out. Bangladesh really didn't need this. A direct hit catches him well short of the crease. And it's Thisara Perera, Sri Lanka's golden boy this series. A length ball that's knocked to mid-off. He decides to take on the fielder there and as it turns out, it'll be the last thing he does this innings. Perera charges in, swoops down and has one stump to aim at
short of a length, opens the face to run it to third man
waits in the crease to a back of a length ball and drops it into the off side
full, on the pads, flicked off them through square leg. That's a gift
cuts in from a back of a length, nudged into the leg side

oh, dear. Bangladesh are losing it here but what's worse is they're all getting out to atrocious shots. This is a short ball that really doesn't deserve a wicket. But of all the vast spaces at the Shere Bangla, he swivels into a pull that lands straight into the waiting hands of midwicket
short of a length, gets on top and drops it into the leg side
short of a length, nips away, backs away and gets out of the line
couldn't have got luckier there. Mahmudullah tentatively pokes at one that straightens from a back of a length and gets big, gets a feather of an edge through the vacant cordon
good length on off, defended into the off side
full outside off, driven into the covers
short of good length, shapes away, left alone
tries to nudge a length ball and gets hit on the pad
back of a length, holds its line, left alone
presses forward to a length ball and opens the face to third man
good length on leg, nudged to midwicket
short of a length, keeps low, defended
short, gets over middle and leg as the batsman arches his back
full on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
banged in halfway down and gets over middle and leg as the batsman ducks
short ball, shapes up for a pull but sees that the bounce is considerable and doesn't want to risk it
short of a length, outside off, opens the face and drops to point

in the air and past the boundary. Short, gets width, gets on top and slaps it uppishly. Stays in the air for long but drops short of deep backward point running to his right and diving. The ball gets past him
short of a length outside off, defended to point
fullish outside off, pushed into the sweeper at cover
full outside off, driven to mid-off
good length outside off, front-foot defense
a picture-perfect length ball on off that's defended. As accurate a first ball as you'll ever see
full outside off, leans into a drive and caresses through the covers. The fielder inside the circle runs back and slides across. Seems like he's just about pulled it back
good length, tucked with the angle to deep backward square leg
short of a length on off, jumps up and defends
short, seams away outside off, jumps and slashes to the right of deep backward point
length ball, moves away late to find the outside edge that drops short of gully. A decent start to his international career
full and cuts in, tucked through the gap at midwicket
sprayed on the pads, flicked away through square leg and the fielder who is slightly backward gets around it
width on offer, slapped out to wide of sweeper cover
clipped off the pads to deep fine leg
full and cuts in, defended
may have been deliberate. No slip in place and sticks his bat out at a length ball that jags away and gets an outside edge to third man
tries to tuck and gets hit on the pad as it shapes in
short of a length, not enough bounce, gets a bottom edge on the pull to midwicket
short, wide, slapped to point
full and swinging away, slashes and misses
short of a length, keeps a little low, keeps it out on the off side
short outside off, did it bounce too much? Yeah, probably did. Square leg umpire immediately spread his arms out
flashes outside off and gets an edge that falls short of the keeper
fullish, seams away, keeps a little low and causes Chandimal to tumble over as he gathers it
pitched up on off, flicked with the turn behind square
clean strike. Advances down to a length ball with a little bit of loop, meets the pitch and smokes it straight over
tossed up legbreak outside off, driven into the covers
another legbreak outside off, cuts but it isn't short enough and he chops int the surface
sliding on leg side and he simply puts bat to ball to ease it away to fine leg
floats up a full toss on leg stump that's swatted away straight to short fine leg
good length, seaming away, drawing the batsman to poke at it and getting him beaten
gets squared up as he closes the face to a fuller one and gets a leading edge into the off side
good length, keeps a little low outside off, defended
length ball on off, blocked
fullish length on middle, flicked to midwicket
short of a length, cuts in and keeps a little low, gets a bit of an inside edge as he defends from the crease
full and flat on off, defended

SL are appeaking for a catch. Chandimal and Dananjaya are pretty sure. They gather for a conference and Chandimal goes for the review. This is the legbreak. Mahmudullah is playing for the turn and the ball spins the other way to beat the edge. Or has it kissed the edge? That's the question. No spike on Ultraedge and SL lose their review
full on off, defended
tossed up outside off, drilled back off the inside of the bat
leg-side fuller ball, swept to short fine
good length, slight turn around off, shuffles across to get on top before nudging it through midwicket
a bit of width, slapped away to sweeper cover
short of a length, width, slapped through point
short of a length, drops to point for a single
easy offerings on the pad, clipped away to deep fine leg
good length, spins in, nudged away
full on middle, turns it away to midwicket
flat, back of a length, spins the other way, punches to point. Rahim wants the second and takes off but Thisara's throw slips out of the hand

huge shout for leg before, given, and Rahim has reviewed. Legbreak, looped up and sliding on leg before spinning away to hit him on the middle and leg channel. Mushfiqur probably didn't pick the variation and got down to sweep with no room. No bat. Pitching just outside leg Very good review
full on leg, pats away to midwicket
flights up a full toss that's punched down to long-on
short of a length, slashed away to deep backward point
back of a length, cuts in on off, drops it to backward point for one
cutting in from a length, tucked to square leg
inswinging fuller ball, clipped straight to midwicket
good length, nips in and hits him high on the pad. Muted appeal turned down
full and angling in, clipped to midwicket
keeps low as it spins in from a length and hits the pad. Angling down leg
worked to square leg
reverse sweep, no room, mistimed to point

now the conventional sweep. He was getting just a little itchy and he has swept to the wrong length. A legbreak that bounces a little more and takes the top edge before settling into the hands of short fine leg
backs away to a short of a length ball and punches to cover
full, drilled to midwicket
short of a length, cuts in, keeps it out down the pitch
pushed away to sweeper cover
flicked off the pads to backward square leg
short ball, ducked under
short, around off, sways out of the line
flighted outside off, eased down to long-on
sliding fuller one, nudged to the legside
shuffles across to a length ball and defends
full on midde and leg, turned away to the square leg region as the keeper runs across
good length, spins in, defended
back of a length, stays back and works to midwicket
short of a length, tucked to fine leg
short, fends it away with a pull to deep backward square leg
short of a length, cuts in, beats the inside edge as he sticks his bat out
back of a length, shapes away, punched into the covers
good length, angling on off, defended
tossed up on middle and leg, eased down to long-on
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
pitched up on middle and leg, defended
meets the pitch with a big stride forward and nudges to short leg
shifts back and keeps this out in front of off
full on the stumps, pushed to mid-off
good length, tucked to midwicket
good length, defended outside off, off the outside of the bat to mid-off
short, swivels and pulls one-bounce to deep backward square leg
back of a length, sticks the bat out in the channel outside off and the ball straightens to rip past the outside edge
nips in very late from wide outside off, Mahmudullah shoulders arms

chipped straight back. Sri Lanka owe Bangladesh a free catching practice session. Pitched right up, closes the face looking for a flick but checks his stroke and chips it straight back to the bowler. Half the side gone but effectively six down
spins away on off, defended
full and coming in on leg, driven to extra cover
full on leg, blocked
short of a length, comes on with the arm, backs away and drags a pull to long-on
pitched up on leg, defended
full, pushed across, eases into a drive to sweeper cover
good length on off, puts his head down and blocks
shoddy. Short outside off, slapped through point. Deep backward point runs across and slides, sees sweeper and leaves it for him, only for sweeper to do the same
short and slanting away, cut straight to deep backward point
short, gets up over middle, no stroke from the batsman
covers the line with a big stride and drives to point
back of a length, keeps low as it spins down the leg side
full outside off, pushes it into the covers
stays back and defends from outside off down the pitch
full and curves in on off, defended
short of a length, ripping turn, no way he's going to make contact with that
jumps back to a shortish ball and defends
short of a length, stabs it to third man with an open face. Fifty for Mahmudullah. Boy doesn't the big occasion bring out the best in him
short, wide, drifts away outside off, loosely chases a cut and gets nowhere near it
back of a length, angled across, worked square of the wicket with a gentle push
gets on top of the bounce outside off and drops it to the right of the bowler
short ball, gets up and pats it to point
good length on middle stump, but angling down the leg side. Wide called
full outside off, sharp offspin in as the ball jags right in. Goes past the bat's outside edge as Mahmudullah misses the front-foot defense. Big appeal for caught behind, but not given
full on middle and off, offspin, defends off the front foot. Takes the leading edge towards the leg side
a biggie! Tossed up full on middle stump, down on one knee and swatted over deep midwicket for a maximum! Hit well
back of a length on off stump,the batsman goes deep into the crease and defends off the back foot
good length on off stump, uses the depth of his crease to defend. Takes an inside edge on to his body
the legspinner to end the over. Good length on middle and leg, and turning across towards off stump. Blocked off the back foot
yorker on off stump, squeezed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length on middle stump, angling down the leg side but hits the batsman's pads instead. Impact outside leg stump
full on middle stump, prods forward and turns it towards the leg side with soft hands
full on middle stump, tapped towards the leg side
full and wide outside off, driven extravagantly off the front foot. But straight to cover. Misses out
back of a length outside off, tries to defend but takes the inside edge between bat and pad. How did that miss off stump? Goes just over it

back of a length outside off, dances down the wicket and smacks this over the bowler's head. Dispatches this length ball away over wide long off. Sweet sound off the bat, and soars over the boundary ropes. Thumped!
good length outside off, opens the bat's face and runs it down to third man
good length on leg stump, clipped off his pads past the square-leg umpire. There's a man in the deep, though
back of a length outside off, stays on the back foot and chops it down to third man for a walking single
back of a length on leg stump, nudged off the back foot towards the leg side. No run on offer
good length on middle stump, angling across his body and it's glanced with the bat's open face to the wide third man
tossed up full outside off, big stride forward and driven back to the bowler
good length on middle and leg, worked off his toes to square leg with ease for a single. Awry throw from the fielder, and a misfield from the bowler allows them to steal a second
back of a length outside off, rocks back and punches to mid off
tossed up outside off again. It's a slower, loopy ball on this occasion. Slapped off the front foot to deep extra cover
good length outside leg stump, straightens after pitching and goes down the leg side
full on middle and leg, clipped off his boots to square leg for a single
good length on middle and leg, flicked off his pads to deep backward square
low full toss on leg, clipped to backward square leg
back of a length, waits before steering to deep backward point

is that a run out? And more importantly is Gunaratne alright? Saifuddin nudges this one to midwicket and there is total chaos on the single. In the end, Saifuddin sacrifices his wicket but Gunaratne had only one stump to aim at so he charges forward with ball in hand,dives forward and shatters the stumps, hits into the fielder backing up, and then the knee of the batsman, running in at full tilt, strikes the side of his head. But he's alright
back of a length, opens the face to backward point
full outside off, driven into the covers
back of a length, slides into the pads and clips it on the way to short fine leg
full on middle, driven past the diving mid-off who half-stops and that's enough time for a brace
short of a length outside off, steered to third man
sliding on the pads, turned away to midwicket
short of a length, angling in, pulled to deep backward square leg
back of a length, outside off, sticks the bat out and gets beaten
worked away to deep square leg for one
low full toss, driven to point
back of a length, shifts back and finds the splice to point
short of good length, rides the bounce and bunts it out to point
full outside off, carved away to cover
full on middle and leg, clipped wide of mid-on
yorker on off, dug out to mid-on
short ball, doesn't entirely get on top but manages to time a pull well enough through square leg
advances and swings to a back of a length delivery and misses
short of good length, drops to point for one
tries to force a pull but doesn't time it too well to midwicket

that's another dismissal to a poor shot. They might just check for the no ball. Has the bowler overstepped? There just might be a small, small portion of the foot behind the line. Benefit of the doubt might go to the bowler. And yes, given. First international wicket for Madushanka. A full toss that's been swatted straight into the hands of midwicket

he's on a hat-trick on debut. What a memorable one he's having! His team is cruising to a big win and he's hastening their push. An extremely full delivery, the perfect one to the tailender. Rubel swings without getting underneath or behind it and the ball curves in to clatter the stumps
short of a length, opens the face and steers to third man
full, slanted across, no feet as he swings and misses
leaves him extremely late from a good length and has him beaten
pushes without feet, again jags away and beats the outside edge
fuller, pushed to mid-off
yorker around off, squeezed out towards point

in the aiiir and taken! A hat-trick for Madhushanka on international debut. And that seals it for Sri Lanka. And it's the priced wicket of Mahmudullah. A perfect finish to a perfect debut. This one's at a short of good length. Mahmudullah backs himself to clear the in-field with this slap but chips it off the splice to extra cover
